results.title: A Fable for friendship
results.creator_credit: Jiri Trnka, Czechoslovak State Film and Unesco
results.brief_description: Animated fable to show what can be achieved by the exchange of ideas and skills between peoples. Explains that the Y shape of the new UNESCO headquarters building is a symbol of the meeting place where peoples of 100 nations come together to benefit from what each has learned in the field of education, science and culture.

results.title: A Dylan Thomas memoir
results.creator_credit: Bayley Silleck and Estuary Film Production
results.brief_description: Recalls the life and times of the poet Dylan Thomas. Includes visits to the places where he lived and worked, and the reminiscences of his wife and daughter

results.title: A Drop of water
results.creator_credit: Agoston Kollanyi, Laszlo Devenyi and Hungarofilm
results.brief_description: Uses creative photography including microcinematography to illustrate the water cycle as a drop of water makes its endless journey to the sea.

results.title: A Drop in the bucket
results.creator_credit: Joseph Henabery, United States. Public Health Service and Warner-Pathe News
results.brief_description: Dramatised story of how dentists, civic leaders, health officials, and people of a town agreed to add fluoride to the community water supply. Explains how the fluoride is added, the cost of fluoridation, and the benefits accruing to the community.

results.title: A Dose of reality
results.creator_credit: Suzanne St Pierre and CBS News
results.brief_description: A study of death and dying with emphasis on giving the terminally ill patient a choice in making decisions until the end. A nurse at a Pennsylvania hospital has developed a unique program for the dying patient. Looks at the prospect of death and what can be done to make it easier for the patient and family.

results.title: A Dolphin's story
results.creator_credit: Arthur Everard, David H. Fowler and New Zealand National Film Unit
results.brief_description: A bottlenose dolphin is captured in the Marlborough Sounds. The good natured animal is transported to “Marineland of New Zealand” in Napier and trained there. The film records its story through to the first public performance.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Arthur Everard, David H. Fowler and New Zealand National Film Unit

results.title: A Divided world
results.brief_description: The film captures the harshness of the struggle for existence between the stoats, foxes, hares, and owls in the dark cold of a winter’s night in a Swedish forest. Photographed by Arne Sucksdorff.
results.description: The film captures the harshness of the struggle for existence between the stoats, foxes, hares, and owls in the dark cold of a winter’s night in a Swedish forest. Photographed by Arne Sucksdorff.

results.title: A Discussion of Herman Melville's 'Bartleby'
results.creator_credit: Larry Yust and Encyclopaedia Britannica Films
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Short story showcase”.
The student is given an opportunity to develop his own independent critical analysis of the book and then to compare his ideas with those of the critic Charles Van Doren who has considered the work in depth. Explores the many possibilities for creative interpretation.

results.title: A Discussion of Fyodor Dostoyevsky's 'The Crocodile'
results.creator_credit: Larry Yust and Encyclopaedia Britannica Films
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Short story showcase”.
Commentator Clifton Fadiman discusses various themes and ideas presented in the short story “The Crocodile” by Dostoyevsky, and he points out the significance of the themes in relation to the life of the author and certain events in Russian history.

results.title: A Discussion of Frank Stockton's 'The Lady, or the tiger?'
results.creator_credit: Larry Yust and Encyclopaedia Britannica Films
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Short story showcase”.
A study of the classic short story by American writer, Frank R. Stockton. Uses “historical” footage interspersed with dramatic narrative finishing with taunting question of suitor’s choice of doom - the tiger or the lady.
